children.text: The roofing in this area has been completed with both lead and zinc, with the lead installed upstream of the zinc roofing members.
Part 3.5.1.2 Corrosion Protection and Compatibility Requirements for Roofing of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA), states that

‘Where different metals are used in a roofing system, including flashings, fasteners, guttering, downpipes, etc., they must be compatible with each other as described in Tables 3.5.1.2a to 3.5.1.2d and – no lead materials can be used upstream from aluminium/zinc coated materials.’

No lead materials should be used in a roofing system upstream of zinc/aluminium coated materials, and Colourbond is zinc based. Therefore, this will need to be rectified in accordance with the NCC’s Building Code of Australia.
